result.execSummary:
The defendant Rashad J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Enroll in and complete the SAFE Program.
Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
If revoked, Defendant would have credit for 33 days.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called: 2:06 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF929, 14CM2206 & 15CM429(Br.1 case)**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn. Date & time set for Sentencing Hearing on Revocation in 14CF929 & 14CM2206. 15CM429 is a Br.1 case and parties are ready to proceed with Plea Hearing today.
State recites joint agreement with respect to revocation. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF929- Ct.1- 9 months MCJ with huber for work, community service and childcare. 
                             14CM2206- Ct.1- 9 months MCJ with huber for work, community service and childcare. 
Defendant is entitled to 105 days credit on both counts. Jail sentences to be concurrent to each other and concurrent to jail sentence in 15CM429. Any outstanding debts to be reduced to civil judgments. 
Parties proceed with Plea Hearing in 15CM429.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed in 15CM429.
State recites agreement. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Possession of THC>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM429- 30 days MCJ with huber for work, community service and childcare, CC & DNA surcharge. Jail is concurrent to 14CF929 & 14CM2206. 0 days credit. 
Attorney Bohn requests a furlough. COURT advises defendant that the Jail will handle any requests for a furlough.

Preliminary Hearing on October 29, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s):  S.P.A. (NON-WAIVABLE)   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort through Everest Metro to retrieve any personal belongings. Third party visitation through Family Resource Center.
